member.summary: The request was blocked because the forced reenrollment check is still pending. This error can only occur on ChromeOS. The error can be emitted by code in chrome/browser/policy/policy_helpers.cc.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.UploadStreamRewindNotSupported
member.summary: The upload failed because the upload stream needed to be re-read, due to a retry or a redirect, but the upload stream doesn't support that operation.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.ContextShutDown
member.summary: The request failed because the URLRequestContext is shutting down, or has been shut down.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.BlockedByResponse
member.summary: The request failed because the response was delivered along with requirements which are not met ('X-Frame-Options' and 'Content-Security-Policy' ancestor checks, for instance).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.BlockedByXssAuditor
member.summary: The request failed after the response was received, based on client-side heuristics that point to the possiblility of a cross-site scripting attack.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CleartextNotPermitted
member.summary: The request was blocked by system policy disallowing some or all cleartext requests. Used for NetworkSecurityPolicy on Android.

member.summary: The proxy requested authentication (for tunnel establishment).

member.summary: Could not create a connection to the proxy server. An error occurred either in resolving its name, or in connecting a socket to it. Note that this does NOT include failures during the actual "CONNECT" method of an HTTP proxy.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.MandatoryProxyConfigurationFailed
member.summary: A mandatory proxy configuration could not be used. Currently this means that a mandatory PAC script could not be fetched, parsed or executed.

member.summary: We've hit the max socket limit for the socket pool while preconnecting. We don't bother trying to preconnect more sockets.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.NetworkAccessDenied
member.summary: Permission to access the network was denied. This is used to distinguish errors that were most likely caused by a firewall from other access denied errors. See also ERR_ACCESS_DENIED.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.TemporarilyThrottled
member.summary: The request throttler module cancelled this request to avoid DDOS.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.HttpsProxyTunnelResponse
member.summary: A request to create an SSL tunnel connection through the HTTPS proxy received a non-200 (OK) and non-407 (Proxy Auth) response. The response body might include a description of why the request failed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SslClientAuthSignatureFailed
member.summary:
We were unable to sign the CertificateVerify data of an SSL client auth handshake with the client certificate's private key.
Possible causes for this include the user implicitly or explicitly denying access to the private key, the private key may not be valid for signing, the key may be relying on a cached handle which is no longer valid, or the CSP won't allow arbitrary data to be signed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.MsgTooBig
member.summary: The message was too large for the transport. (for example a UDP message which exceeds size threshold).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SpdySessionAlreadyExists
member.summary: A SPDY session already exists, and should be used instead of this connection.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.WsProtocolError
member.summary: Websocket protocol error. Indicates that we are terminating the connection due to a malformed frame or other protocol violation.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.AddressInUse
member.summary: Returned when attempting to bind an address that is already in use.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SslHandshakeNotCompleted
member.summary: An operation failed because the SSL handshake has not completed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SslBadPeerPublicKey
member.summary: SSL peer's public key is invalid.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SslPinnedKeyNotInCertChain
member.summary: The certificate didn't match the built-in public key pins for the host name. The pins are set in net/http/transport_security_state.cc and require that one of a set of public keys exist on the path from the leaf to the root.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.ClientAuthCertTypeUnsupported
member.summary: Server request for client certificate did not contain any types we support.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.OriginBoundCertGenerationTypeMismatch
member.summary: Server requested one type of cert, then requested a different type while the first was still being generated.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SslDecryptErrorAlert
member.summary: An SSL peer sent us a fatal decrypt_error alert. This typically occurs when a peer could not correctly verify a signature (in CertificateVerify or ServerKeyExchange) or validate a Finished message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.WsThrottleQueueTooLarge
member.summary: There are too many pending WebSocketJob instances, so the new job was not pushed to the queue.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SslServerCertChanged
member.summary: The SSL server certificate changed in a renegotiation.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SslUnrecognizedNameAlert
member.summary: The SSL server sent us a fatal unrecognized_name alert.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SocketSetReceiveBufferSizeError
member.summary: Failed to set the socket's receive buffer size as requested.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SocketSetSendBufferSizeError
member.summary: Failed to set the socket's send buffer size as requested.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SocketReceiveBufferSizeUnchangeable
member.summary: Failed to set the socket's receive buffer size as requested, despite success return code from setsockopt.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SocketSendBufferSizeUnchangeable
member.summary: Failed to set the socket's send buffer size as requested, despite success return code from setsockopt.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SslClientAuthCertBadFormat
member.summary: Failed to import a client certificate from the platform store into the SSL library.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.IcannNameCollision
member.summary: Resolving a hostname to an IP address list included the IPv4 address "127.0.53.53". This is a special IP address which ICANN has recommended to indicate there was a name collision, and alert admins to a potential problem.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SslServerCertBadFormat
member.summary: The SSL server presented a certificate which could not be decoded. This is not a certificate error code as no X509Certificate object is available. This error is fatal.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CtSthParsingFailed
member.summary: Certificate Transparency: Received a signed tree head that failed to parse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CtSthIncomplete
member.summary: Certificate Transparency: Received a signed tree head whose JSON parsing was OK but was missing some of the fields.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.UnableToReuseConnectionForProxyAuth
member.summary: The attempt to reuse a connection to send proxy auth credentials failed before the AuthController was used to generate credentials. The caller should reuse the controller with a new connection. This error is only used internally by the network stack.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CtConsistencyProofParsingFailed
member.summary: Certificate Transparency: Failed to parse the received consistency proof.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SslObsoleteCipher
member.summary: The SSL server required an unsupported cipher suite that has since been removed. This error will temporarily be signaled on a fallback for one or two releases immediately following a cipher suite's removal, after which the fallback will be removed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.WsUpgrade
member.summary: When a WebSocket handshake is done successfully and the connection has been upgraded, the URLRequest is cancelled with this error code.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertCommonNameInvalid
member.summary:
Certificate error codes
The values of certificate error codes must be consecutive.
The server responded with a certificate whose common name did not match the host name. This could mean:
1. An attacker has redirected our traffic to their server and is presenting a certificate for which they know the private key.
2. The server is misconfigured and responding with the wrong cert.
3. The user is on a wireless network and is being redirected to the network's login page.
4. The OS has used a DNS search suffix and the server doesn't have a certificate for the abbreviated name in the address bar.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertDateInvalid
member.summary:
The server responded with a certificate that, by our clock, appears to either not yet be valid or to have expired. This could mean:
1. An attacker is presenting an old certificate for which they have managed to obtain the private key.
2. The server is misconfigured and is not presenting a valid cert.
3. Our clock is wrong.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertAuthorityInvalid
member.summary:
The server responded with a certificate that is signed by an authority we don't trust. The could mean:
1. An attacker has substituted the real certificate for a cert that contains their public key and is signed by their cousin.
2. The server operator has a legitimate certificate from a CA we don't know about, but should trust.
3. The server is presenting a self-signed certificate, providing no defense against active attackers (but foiling passive attackers).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertContainsErrors
member.summary:
The server responded with a certificate that contains errors. This error is not recoverable.
MSDN describes this error as follows: "The SSL certificate contains errors." NOTE: It's unclear how this differs from ERR_CERT_INVALID. For consistency, use that code instead of this one from now on.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertNoRevocationMechanism
member.summary: The certificate has no mechanism for determining if it is revoked. In effect, this certificate cannot be revoked.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertUnableToCheckRevocation
member.summary:
Revocation information for the security certificate for this site is not available. This could mean:
1. An attacker has compromised the private key in the certificate and is blocking our attempt to find out that the cert was revoked.
2. The certificate is unrevoked, but the revocation server is busy or unavailable.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertRevoked
member.summary: The server responded with a certificate has been revoked. We have the capability to ignore this error, but it is probably not the thing to do.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertInvalid
member.summary:
The server responded with a certificate that is invalid. This error is not recoverable.
MSDN describes this error as follows: "The SSL certificate is invalid."

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertWeakSignatureAlgorithm
member.summary: The server responded with a certificate that is signed using a weak signature algorithm.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertNonUniqueName
member.summary: The host name specified in the certificate is not unique.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertWeakKey
member.summary: The server responded with a certificate that contains a weak key (e.g. a too-small RSA key).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertNameConstraintViolation
member.summary: The certificate claimed DNS names that are in violation of name constraints.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertValidityTooLong
member.summary: The certificate's validity period is too long.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertificateTransparencyRequired
member.summary: Certificate Transparency was required for this connection, but the server did not provide CT information that complied with the policy.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertEnd
member.summary: The value immediately past the last certificate error code.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.InvalidUrl
member.summary: The URL is invalid.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.DisallowedUrlScheme
member.summary: The scheme of the URL is disallowed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.UnknownUrlScheme
member.summary: The scheme of the URL is unknown.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.TooManyRedirects
member.summary: Attempting to load an URL resulted in too many redirects.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.UnsafeRedirect
member.summary: Attempting to load an URL resulted in an unsafe redirect (e.g., a redirect to file:// is considered unsafe).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.UnsafePort
member.summary: Attempting to load an URL with an unsafe port number. These are port numbers that correspond to services, which are not robust to spurious input that may be constructed as a result of an allowed web construct (e.g., HTTP looks a lot like SMTP, so form submission to port 25 is denied).

member.summary: The server's response was invalid.

member.summary: Error in chunked transfer encoding.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SpdyServerRefusedStream
member.summary: SPDY server refused the stream. Client should retry. This should never be a user-visible error.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SpdyPingFailed
member.summary: SPDY server didn't respond to the PING message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.ContentLengthMismatch
member.summary: The HTTP response body transferred fewer bytes than were advertised by the Content-Length header when the connection is closed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.IncompleteChunkedEncoding
member.summary: The HTTP response body is transferred with Chunked-Encoding, but the terminating zero-length chunk was never sent when the connection is closed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.QuicProtocolError
member.summary: There is a QUIC protocol error.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.ResponseHeadersTruncated
member.summary: The HTTP headers were truncated by an EOF.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.QuicHandshakeFailed
member.summary: The QUIC crytpo handshake failed. This means that the server was unable to read any requests sent, so they may be resent.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SpdyInadequateTransportSecurity
member.summary: Transport security is inadequate for the SPDY version.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SpdyFlowControlError
member.summary: The peer violated SPDY flow control.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SpdyFrameSizeError
member.summary: The peer sent an improperly sized SPDY frame.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SpdyCompressionError
member.summary: Decoding or encoding of compressed SPDY headers failed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.ProxyAuthRequestedWithNoConnection
member.summary: Proxy Auth Requested without a valid Client Socket Handle.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.Http11Required
member.summary: HTTP_1_1_REQUIRED error code received on HTTP/2 session.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.ProxyHttp11Required
member.summary: HTTP_1_1_REQUIRED error code received on HTTP/2 session to proxy.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.PacScriptTerminated
member.summary: The PAC script terminated fatally and must be reloaded.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.InvalidHttpResponse
member.summary: The server was expected to return an HTTP/1.x response, but did not. Rather than treat it as HTTP/0.9, this error is returned.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.ContentDecodingInitFailed
member.summary: Initializing content decoding failed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SpdyRstStreamNoErrorReceived
member.summary: Received HTTP/2 RST_STREAM frame with NO_ERROR error code. This error should be handled internally by HTTP/2 code, and should not make it above the SpdyStream layer.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CacheMiss
member.summary: The cache does not have the requested entry.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CacheReadFailure
member.summary: Unable to read from the disk cache.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CacheWriteFailure
member.summary: Unable to write to the disk cache.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CacheOperationNotSupported
member.summary: The operation is not supported for this entry.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CacheOpenFailure
member.summary: The disk cache is unable to open this entry.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CacheCreateFailure
member.summary: The disk cache is unable to create this entry.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CacheRace
member.summary: Multiple transactions are racing to create disk cache entries. This is an internal error returned from the HttpCache to the HttpCacheTransaction that tells the transaction to restart the entry-creation logic because the state of the cache has changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CacheChecksumReadFailure
member.summary: The cache was unable to read a checksum record on an entry. This can be returned from attempts to read from the cache. It is an internal error, returned by the SimpleCache backend, but not by any URLRequest methods or members.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CacheChecksumMismatch
member.summary: The cache found an entry with an invalid checksum. This can be returned from attempts to read from the cache. It is an internal error, returned by the SimpleCache backend, but not by any URLRequest methods or members.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CacheLockTimeout
member.summary: Internal error code for the HTTP cache. The cache lock timeout has fired.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CacheAuthFailureAfterRead
member.summary: Received a challenge after the transaction has read some data, and the credentials aren't available. There isn't a way to get them at that point.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.InsecureResponse
member.summary: The server's response was insecure (e.g. there was a cert error).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.NoPrivateKeyForCert
member.summary: An attempt to import a client certificate failed, as the user's key database lacked a corresponding private key.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.AddUserCertFailed
member.summary: An error adding a certificate to the OS certificate database.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.FtpFailed
member.summary: A generic error for failed FTP control connection command. If possible, please use or add a more specific error code.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.FtpServiceUnavailable
member.summary: The server cannot fulfill the request at this point. This is a temporary error. FTP response code 421.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.FtpTransferAborted
member.summary: The server has aborted the transfer. FTP response code 426.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.FtpFileBusy
member.summary: The file is busy, or some other temporary error condition on opening the file. FTP response code 450.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.FtpSyntaxError
member.summary: Server rejected our command because of syntax errors. FTP response codes 500, 501.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.FtpCommandNotSupported
member.summary: Server does not support the command we issued. FTP response codes 502, 504.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.FtpBadCommandSequence
member.summary: Server rejected our command because we didn't issue the commands in right order. FTP response code 503.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.Pkcs12ImportBadPassword
member.summary: PKCS #12 import failed due to incorrect password.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.Pkcs12ImportFailed
member.summary: PKCS #12 import failed due to other error.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.ImportCaCertNotCa
member.summary: CA import failed - not a CA cert.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.ImportCertAlreadyExists
member.summary: Import failed - certificate already exists in database. Note it's a little weird this is an error but reimporting a PKCS12 is ok (no-op). That's how Mozilla does it, though.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.ImportCaCertFailed
member.summary: CA import failed due to some other error.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.ImportServerCertFailed
member.summary: Server certificate import failed due to some internal error.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.Pkcs12ImportInvalidMac
member.summary: PKCS #12 import failed due to invalid MAC.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.Pkcs12ImportInvalidFile
member.summary: PKCS #12 import failed due to invalid/corrupt file.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.Pkcs12ImportUnsupported
member.summary: PKCS #12 import failed due to unsupported features.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.KeyGenerationFailed
member.summary: Key generation failed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.PrivateKeyExportFailed
member.summary: Failure to export private key.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.SelfSignedCertGenerationFailed
member.summary: Self-signed certificate generation failed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.CertDatabaseChanged
member.summary: The certificate database changed in some way.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.DnsMalformedResponse
member.summary: DNS resolver received a malformed response.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.DnsServerRequiresTcp
member.summary: DNS server requires TCP

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.DnsServerFailed
member.summary: DNS server failed. This error is returned for all of the following error conditions: 1 - Format error - The name server was unable to interpret the query. 2 - Server failure - The name server was unable to process this query due to a problem with the name server. 4 - Not Implemented - The name server does not support the requested kind of query. 5 - Refused - The name server refuses to perform the specified operation for policy reasons.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.DnsTimedOut
member.summary: DNS transaction timed out.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.DnsCacheMiss
member.summary: The entry was not found in cache, for cache-only lookups.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.DnsSearchEmpty
member.summary: Suffix search list rules prevent resolution of the given host name.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.ChromiumNetErrorCode.DnsSortError
member.summary: Failed to sort addresses according to RFC3484.

This parameter is not used.

member.name: M:Openfin.Desktop.ExternalWindowObserver.onSysCommand(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Called in response to WM_SYSCOMMAND.
member.param: A handle to the window.
WM_SYSCOMMAND
The type of system command requested.

The low-order word specifies the horizontal position of the cursor, in screen coordinates, if a window menu command is chosen with the mouse. Otherwise, this parameter is not used.
The high-order word specifies the vertical position of the cursor, in s creen coordinates, if a window menu command is chosen with the mouse. This parameter is 1 if the command is chosen using a system accelerator, or zero if using a mnemonic.
Will bypass the default WndProc when set to true.

member.name: T:Openfin.Desktop.ExternalWindowAckResult
member.summary:
Encapsulates and sends the result of an ExternalWindow action to the desktop. The result is sent after invocation of an ExternalWindow method.
In cases where this behavior needs to be prevented, such as when work done should be handled by another thread, Set PreventAutomaticSend to true and call send() when the result state is determined.
send() will be called automatically by Dispose() if it has not been explicitly called prior.

member.name: M:Openfin.Desktop.ExternalWindowAckResult.#ctor(Openfin.Desktop.DesktopConnection,System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an instance.
member.param: The websocket connection that owns this ACK
The message ID to map this result back to any pending callbacks in other apps.
Token which resolves to the app with the pending callback.

member.name: M:Openfin.Desktop.ExternalWindowAckResult.send(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Sends the result to the desktop triggering pending callbacks in other apps.
member.param: True when the operation was successful
When succeeded is false, a reason is sent on error.

member.name: M:Openfin.Desktop.ExternalWindowAckResult.Dispose
member.summary: Will call send() if not done so already.

member.name: P:Openfin.Desktop.ExternalWindowAckResult.PreventAutomaticSend
member.summary: Prevents send() from being called directly after invocation of an ExternalWindow method. If prevented send() must be called explicitly otherwise it will be called on Dispose().

"failed": The close/terminate operation was unable to complete.
Default: "failed"

member.name: T:Openfin.Desktop.DesktopSystem
member.summary:
An object representing the core of the OpenFin Desktop. Allows the developer to perform system-level actions, such as accessing logs, viewing processes, clearing the cache and exiting the Desktop.
In order to use the System object, an application must have admin-level privileges (e.g., isAdmin must be set to true when in the options when the application is created).

member.name: M:Openfin.Desktop.DesktopSystem.getProcessList(Openfin.Desktop.AckCallback,Openfin.Desktop.AckCallback)
member.summary:
Retrieves an array of all App Desktop processes that are currently running.
Each element in the array is an object containing the uuid and the name of the application to which the process belongs.
Requires administrator privileges.
member.remarks: The returned object takes the form: [ { cpuUsage: (decimal) the percentage of total CPU usage, name: (string) the application name, nonPagedPoolUsage: (integer) the current nonpaged pool usage in bytes, pageFaultCount: (integer) the number of page faults, pagedPoolUsage: (integer) the current paged pool usage in bytes, pagefileUsage: (integer) the total amount of memory in bytes that the memory manager has committed, peakNonPagedPoolUsage: (integer) the peak nonpaged pool usage in bytes, peakPagedPoolUsage: (integer) the peak paged pool usage in bytes, peakPagefileUsage: (integer) the peak value in bytes of pagefileUsage during the lifetime of this process, peakWorkingSetSize: (integer) the peak working set size in bytes, processId: (integer) the native process identifier, uuid: (string) the application UUID, workingSetSize: (integer) the current working set size (both shared and private data) in bytes }, ... ]
member.param: A function that is called and passed the process list.
(Optional) A function that is called if the method fails. The reason for failure is passed as an argument.

member.summary: Retrieves the proxy settings object.

member.param: The UUID of the application that is being wrapped.
member.returns: The wrapped application.

member.summary: Wraps an existing external application using the specified UUID.
member.param: The UUID of the external application that is being wrapped.
member.returns: The wrapped external application.

Window handle of the new parent window

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_BORDER
member.summary: The window has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_CAPTION
member.summary: The window has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_CHILD
member.summary: The window is a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_DISABLED
member.summary: The window is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use the EnableWindow function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_DLGFRAME
member.summary: The window has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_GROUP
member.summary: The window is the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the WS_TABSTOP style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys. You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_HSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially maximized.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially minimized.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_OVERLAPPED
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_POPUP
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_POPUPWINDOW
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. The WS_CAPTION and WS_POPUPWINDOW styles must be combined to make the window menu visible.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_SIZEFRAME
member.summary: The window has a sizing border.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_SYSMENU
member.summary: The window has a window menu on its title bar. The WS_CAPTION style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_TABSTOP
member.summary: The window is a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the WS_TABSTOP style. You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function. For user-created windows and modeless dialogs to work with tab stops, alter the message loop to call the IsDialogMessage function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_VISIBLE
member.summary: The window is initially visible. This style can be turned on and off by using the ShowWindow or SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStyles.WS_VSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.RedrawWindowFlags.Invalidate
member.summary: Invalidates the rectangle or region that you specify in lprcUpdate or hrgnUpdate. You can set only one of these parameters to a non-NULL value. If both are NULL, RDW_INVALIDATE invalidates the entire window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.RedrawWindowFlags.InternalPaint
member.summary: Causes the OS to post a WM_PAINT message to the window regardless of whether a portion of the window is invalid.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.RedrawWindowFlags.Erase
member.summary: Causes the window to receive a WM_ERASEBKGND message when the window is repainted. Specify this value in combination with the RDW_INVALIDATE value; otherwise, RDW_ERASE has no effect.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.RedrawWindowFlags.Validate
member.summary: Validates the rectangle or region that you specify in lprcUpdate or hrgnUpdate. You can set only one of these parameters to a non-NULL value. If both are NULL, RDW_VALIDATE validates the entire window. This value does not affect internal WM_PAINT messages.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.RedrawWindowFlags.NoErase
member.summary: Suppresses any pending WM_ERASEBKGND messages.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.RedrawWindowFlags.NoChildren
member.summary: Excludes child windows, if any, from the repainting operation.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.RedrawWindowFlags.AllChildren
member.summary: Includes child windows, if any, in the repainting operation.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.RedrawWindowFlags.UpdateNow
member.summary: Causes the affected windows, which you specify by setting the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN values, to receive WM_ERASEBKGND and WM_PAINT messages before the RedrawWindow returns, if necessary.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.RedrawWindowFlags.EraseNow
member.summary: Causes the affected windows, which you specify by setting the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN values, to receive WM_ERASEBKGND messages before RedrawWindow returns, if necessary. The affected windows receive WM_PAINT messages at the ordinary time.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_ACCEPTFILES
member.summary: Specifies a window that accepts drag-drop files.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: Specifies a window that has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_COMPOSITED
member.summary: Specifies a window that paints all descendants in bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering. This cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC. This style is not supported in Windows 2000.
member.remarks: With WS_EX_COMPOSITED set, all descendants of a window get bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering. Bottom-to-top painting order allows a descendent window to have translucency (alpha) and transparency (color-key) effects, but only if the descendent window also has the WS_EX_TRANSPARENT bit set. Double-buffering allows the window and its descendents to be painted without flicker.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Specifies a window that includes a question mark in the title bar. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message. The child window should pass the message to the parent window procedure, which should call the WinHelp function using the HELP_WM_HELP command. The Help application displays a pop-up window that typically contains help for the child window. WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP cannot be used with the WS_MAXIMIZEBOX or WS_MINIMIZEBOX styles.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: Specifies a window which contains child windows that should take part in dialog box navigation. If this style is specified, the dialog manager recurses into children of this window when performing navigation operations such as handling the TAB key, an arrow key, or a keyboard mnemonic.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: Specifies a window that has a double border.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LAYERED
member.summary: Specifies a window that is a layered window. This cannot be used for child windows or if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: Specifies a window with the horizontal origin on the right edge. Increasing horizontal values advance to the left. The shell language must support reading-order alignment for this to take effect.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: Specifies a window that has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Specifies a window with the vertical scroll bar (if present) to the left of the client area. The shell language must support reading-order alignment for this to take effect.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: Specifies a window that displays text using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: Specifies a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Specifies a top-level window created with this style does not become the foreground window when the user clicks it. The system does not bring this window to the foreground when the user minimizes or closes the foreground window. The window does not appear on the taskbar by default. To force the window to appear on the taskbar, use the WS_EX_APPWINDOW style. To activate the window, use the SetActiveWindow or SetForegroundWindow function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOINHERITLAYOUT
member.summary: Specifies a window which does not pass its window layout to its child windows.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: Specifies that a child window created with this style does not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when it is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Specifies an overlapped window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: Specifies a palette window, which is a modeless dialog box that presents an array of commands.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RIGHT
member.summary: Specifies a window that has generic "right-aligned" properties. This depends on the window class. The shell language must support reading-order alignment for this to take effect. Using the WS_EX_RIGHT style has the same effect as using the SS_RIGHT (static), ES_RIGHT (edit), and BS_RIGHT/BS_RIGHTBUTTON (button) control styles.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Specifies a window with the vertical scroll bar (if present) to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: Specifies a window that displays text using right-to-left reading-order properties. The shell language must support reading-order alignment for this to take effect.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: Specifies a window with a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: Specifies a window that is intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: Specifies a window that should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated. To add or remove this style, use the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Specifies a window that should not be painted until siblings beneath the window (that were created by the same thread) have been painted. The window appears transparent because the bits of underlying sibling windows have already been painted. To achieve transparency without these restrictions, use the SetWindowRgn function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: Specifies a window that has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.Summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.Summary: Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.Summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.Summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOMOVE
member.Summary: Retains the current position (ignores the x and y parameters).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.Summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.Summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.Summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOSIZE
member.Summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOZORDER
member.Summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: T:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SpecialWindowHandles
member.summary: Special window handles

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SpecialWindowHandles.HWND_TOP
member.summary: Places the window at the top of the Z order.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SpecialWindowHandles.HWND_BOTTOM
member.summary: Places the window at the bottom of the Z order. If the hWnd parameter identifies a topmost window, the window loses its topmost status and is placed at the bottom of all other windows.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SpecialWindowHandles.HWND_TOPMOST
member.summary: Places the window above all non-topmost windows. The window maintains its topmost position even when it is deactivated.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SpecialWindowHandles.HWND_NOTOPMOST
member.summary: Places the window above all non-topmost windows (that is, behind all topmost windows). This flag has no effect if the window is already a non-topmost window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_ASYNCWINDOWPOS
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_DEFERERASE
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_HIDEWINDOW
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOREPOSITION
member.summary: Same as the SWP_NOOWNERZORDER flag.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: T:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM
member.summary: Windows Messages Defined in winuser.h from Windows SDK v6.1 Documentation pulled from MSDN.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NULL
member.summary: The WM_NULL message performs no operation. An application sends the WM_NULL message if it wants to post a message that the recipient window will ignore.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.CREATE
member.summary: The WM_CREATE message is sent when an application requests that a window be created by calling the CreateWindowEx or CreateWindow function. (The message is sent before the function returns.) The window procedure of the new window receives this message after the window is created, but before the window becomes visible.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.DESTROY
F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.MOVE
member.summary: The WM_MOVE message is sent after a window has been moved.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SIZE
member.summary: The WM_SIZE message is sent to a window after its size has changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.ACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_ACTIVATE message is sent to both the window being activated and the window being deactivated. If the windows use the same input queue, the message is sent synchronously, first to the window procedure of the top-level window being deactivated, then to the window procedure of the top-level window being activated. If the windows use different input queues, the message is sent asynchronously, so the window is activated immediately.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SETFOCUS
member.summary: The WM_SETFOCUS message is sent to a window after it has gained the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.KILLFOCUS
member.summary: The WM_KILLFOCUS message is sent to a window immediately before it loses the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.ENABLE
member.summary: The WM_ENABLE message is sent when an application changes the enabled state of a window. It is sent to the window whose enabled state is changing. This message is sent before the EnableWindow function returns, but after the enabled state (WS_DISABLED style bit) of the window has changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SETREDRAW
member.summary: An application sends the WM_SETREDRAW message to a window to allow changes in that window to be redrawn or to prevent changes in that window from being redrawn.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SETTEXT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_SETTEXT message to set the text of a window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.GETTEXT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETTEXT message to copy the text that corresponds to a window into a buffer provided by the caller.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.GETTEXTLENGTH
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETTEXTLENGTH message to determine the length, in characters, of the text associated with a window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.PAINT
member.summary: The WM_PAINT message is sent when the system or another application makes a request to paint a portion of an application's window. The message is sent when the UpdateWindow or RedrawWindow function is called, or by the DispatchMessage function when the application obtains a WM_PAINT message by using the GetMessage or PeekMessage function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.CLOSE
member.summary: The WM_CLOSE message is sent as a signal that a window or an application should terminate.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.QUERYENDSESSION
member.summary: The WM_QUERYENDSESSION message is sent when the user chooses to end the session or when an application calls one of the system shutdown functions. If any application returns zero, the session is not ended. The system stops sending WM_QUERYENDSESSION messages as soon as one application returns zero. After processing this message, the system sends the WM_ENDSESSION message with the wParam parameter set to the results of the WM_QUERYENDSESSION message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.QUERYOPEN
member.summary: The WM_QUERYOPEN message is sent to an icon when the user requests that the window be restored to its previous size and position.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.ENDSESSION
member.summary: The WM_ENDSESSION message is sent to an application after the system processes the results of the WM_QUERYENDSESSION message. The WM_ENDSESSION message informs the application whether the session is ending.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.QUIT
member.summary: The WM_QUIT message indicates a request to terminate an application and is generated when the application calls the PostQuitMessage function. It causes the GetMessage function to return zero.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.ERASEBKGND
member.summary: The WM_ERASEBKGND message is sent when the window background must be erased (for example, when a window is resized). The message is sent to prepare an invalidated portion of a window for painting.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SYSCOLORCHANGE
member.summary: This message is sent to all top-level windows when a change is made to a system color setting.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: The WM_SHOWWINDOW message is sent to a window when the window is about to be hidden or shown.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.WININICHANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_WININICHANGE message to all top-level windows after making a change to the WIN.INI file. The SystemParametersInfo function sends this message after an application uses the function to change a setting in WIN.INI. Note The WM_WININICHANGE message is provided only for compatibility with earlier versions of the system. Applications should use the WM_SETTINGCHANGE message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SETTINGCHANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_WININICHANGE message to all top-level windows after making a change to the WIN.INI file. The SystemParametersInfo function sends this message after an application uses the function to change a setting in WIN.INI. Note The WM_WININICHANGE message is provided only for compatibility with earlier versions of the system. Applications should use the WM_SETTINGCHANGE message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.DEVMODECHANGE
member.summary: The WM_DEVMODECHANGE message is sent to all top-level windows whenever the user changes device-mode settings.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.ACTIVATEAPP
member.summary: The WM_ACTIVATEAPP message is sent when a window belonging to a different application than the active window is about to be activated. The message is sent to the application whose window is being activated and to the application whose window is being deactivated.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.FONTCHANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_FONTCHANGE message to all top-level windows in the system after changing the pool of font resources.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.TIMECHANGE
member.summary: A message that is sent whenever there is a change in the system time.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.CANCELMODE
member.summary: The WM_CANCELMODE message is sent to cancel certain modes, such as mouse capture. For example, the system sends this message to the active window when a dialog box or message box is displayed. Certain functions also send this message explicitly to the specified window regardless of whether it is the active window. For example, the EnableWindow function sends this message when disabling the specified window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SETCURSOR
member.summary: The WM_SETCURSOR message is sent to a window if the mouse causes the cursor to move within a window and mouse input is not captured.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.MOUSEACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEACTIVATE message is sent when the cursor is in an inactive window and the user presses a mouse button. The parent window receives this message only if the child window passes it to the DefWindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.CHILDACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_CHILDACTIVATE message is sent to a child window when the user clicks the window's title bar or when the window is activated, moved, or sized.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.QUEUESYNC
member.summary: The WM_QUEUESYNC message is sent by a computer-based training (CBT) application to separate user-input messages from other messages sent through the WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK Hook procedure.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.GETMINMAXINFO
member.summary: The WM_GETMINMAXINFO message is sent to a window when the size or position of the window is about to change. An application can use this message to override the window's default maximized size and position, or its default minimum or maximum tracking size.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.PAINTICON
member.summary: Windows NT 3.51 and earlier: The WM_PAINTICON message is sent to a minimized window when the icon is to be painted. This message is not sent by newer versions of Microsoft Windows, except in unusual circumstances explained in the Remarks.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.ICONERASEBKGND
member.summary: Windows NT 3.51 and earlier: The WM_ICONERASEBKGND message is sent to a minimized window when the background of the icon must be filled before painting the icon. A window receives this message only if a class icon is defined for the window; otherwise, WM_ERASEBKGND is sent. This message is not sent by newer versions of Windows.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NEXTDLGCTL
member.summary: The WM_NEXTDLGCTL message is sent to a dialog box procedure to set the keyboard focus to a different control in the dialog box.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SPOOLERSTATUS
member.summary: The WM_SPOOLERSTATUS message is sent from Print Manager whenever a job is added to or removed from the Print Manager queue.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.DRAWITEM
member.summary: The WM_DRAWITEM message is sent to the parent window of an owner-drawn button, combo box, list box, or menu when a visual aspect of the button, combo box, list box, or menu has changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.MEASUREITEM
member.summary: The WM_MEASUREITEM message is sent to the owner window of a combo box, list box, list view control, or menu item when the control or menu is created.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.DELETEITEM
member.summary: Sent to the owner of a list box or combo box when the list box or combo box is destroyed or when items are removed by the LB_DELETESTRING, LB_RESETCONTENT, CB_DELETESTRING, or CB_RESETCONTENT message. The system sends a WM_DELETEITEM message for each deleted item. The system sends the WM_DELETEITEM message for any deleted list box or combo box item with nonzero item data.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.VKEYTOITEM
member.summary: Sent by a list box with the LBS_WANTKEYBOARDINPUT style to its owner in response to a WM_KEYDOWN message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.CHARTOITEM
member.summary: Sent by a list box with the LBS_WANTKEYBOARDINPUT style to its owner in response to a WM_CHAR message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SETFONT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_SETFONT message to specify the font that a control is to use when drawing text.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.GETFONT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETFONT message to a control to retrieve the font with which the control is currently drawing its text.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SETHOTKEY
member.summary: An application sends a WM_SETHOTKEY message to a window to associate a hot key with the window. When the user presses the hot key, the system activates the window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.GETHOTKEY
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETHOTKEY message to determine the hot key associated with a window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.QUERYDRAGICON
member.summary: The WM_QUERYDRAGICON message is sent to a minimized (iconic) window. The window is about to be dragged by the user but does not have an icon defined for its class. An application can return a handle to an icon or cursor. The system displays this cursor or icon while the user drags the icon.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.COMPAREITEM
member.summary: The system sends the WM_COMPAREITEM message to determine the relative position of a new item in the sorted list of an owner-drawn combo box or list box. Whenever the application adds a new item, the system sends this message to the owner of a combo box or list box created with the CBS_SORT or LBS_SORT style.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.GETOBJECT
member.summary: Active Accessibility sends the WM_GETOBJECT message to obtain information about an accessible object contained in a server application. Applications never send this message directly. It is sent only by Active Accessibility in response to calls to AccessibleObjectFromPoint, AccessibleObjectFromEvent, or AccessibleObjectFromWindow. However, server applications handle this message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.COMPACTING
member.summary: The WM_COMPACTING message is sent to all top-level windows when the system detects more than 12.5 percent of system time over a 30- to 60-second interval is being spent compacting memory. This indicates that system memory is low.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.COMMNOTIFY
member.summary: WM_COMMNOTIFY is Obsolete for Win32-Based Applications

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.WINDOWPOSCHANGING
member.summary: The WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message is sent to a window whose size, position, or place in the Z order is about to change as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or another window-management function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.WINDOWPOSCHANGED
member.summary: The WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED message is sent to a window whose size, position, or place in the Z order has changed as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or another window-management function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.POWER
member.summary: Notifies applications that the system, typically a battery-powered personal computer, is about to enter a suspended mode. Use: POWERBROADCAST

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.COPYDATA
member.summary: An application sends the WM_COPYDATA message to pass data to another application.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.CANCELJOURNAL
member.summary: The WM_CANCELJOURNAL message is posted to an application when a user cancels the application's journaling activities. The message is posted with a NULL window handle.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NOTIFY
member.summary: Sent by a common control to its parent window when an event has occurred or the control requires some information.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.INPUTLANGCHANGEREQUEST
member.summary: The WM_INPUTLANGCHANGEREQUEST message is posted to the window with the focus when the user chooses a new input language, either with the hotkey (specified in the Keyboard control panel application) or from the indicator on the system taskbar. An application can accept the change by passing the message to the DefWindowProc function or reject the change (and prevent it from taking place) by returning immediately.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.INPUTLANGCHANGE
member.summary: The WM_INPUTLANGCHANGE message is sent to the topmost affected window after an application's input language has been changed. You should make any application-specific settings and pass the message to the DefWindowProc function, which passes the message to all first-level child windows. These child windows can pass the message to DefWindowProc to have it pass the message to their child windows, and so on.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.TCARD
member.summary: Sent to an application that has initiated a training card with Microsoft Windows Help. The message informs the application when the user clicks an authorable button. An application initiates a training card by specifying the HELP_TCARD command in a call to the WinHelp function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.HELP
member.summary: Indicates that the user pressed the F1 key. If a menu is active when F1 is pressed, WM_HELP is sent to the window associated with the menu; otherwise, WM_HELP is sent to the window that has the keyboard focus. If no window has the keyboard focus, WM_HELP is sent to the currently active window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.USERCHANGED
member.summary: The WM_USERCHANGED message is sent to all windows after the user has logged on or off. When the user logs on or off, the system updates the user-specific settings. The system sends this message immediately after updating the settings.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NOTIFYFORMAT
member.summary: Determines if a window accepts ANSI or Unicode structures in the WM_NOTIFY notification message. WM_NOTIFYFORMAT messages are sent from a common control to its parent window and from the parent window to the common control.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.CONTEXTMENU
member.summary: The WM_CONTEXTMENU message notifies a window that the user clicked the right mouse button (right-clicked) in the window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.STYLECHANGING
member.summary: The WM_STYLECHANGING message is sent to a window when the SetWindowLong function is about to change one or more of the window's styles.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.STYLECHANGED
member.summary: The WM_STYLECHANGED message is sent to a window after the SetWindowLong function has changed one or more of the window's styles

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.DISPLAYCHANGE
member.summary: The WM_DISPLAYCHANGE message is sent to all windows when the display resolution has changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.GETICON
member.summary: The WM_GETICON message is sent to a window to retrieve a handle to the large or small icon associated with a window. The system displays the large icon in the ALT+TAB dialog, and the small icon in the window caption.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SETICON
member.summary: An application sends the WM_SETICON message to associate a new large or small icon with a window. The system displays the large icon in the ALT+TAB dialog box, and the small icon in the window caption.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCCREATE
member.summary: The WM_NCCREATE message is sent prior to the WM_CREATE message when a window is first created.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCDESTROY
member.summary: The WM_NCDESTROY message informs a window that its nonclient area is being destroyed. The DestroyWindow function sends the WM_NCDESTROY message to the window following the WM_DESTROY message. WM_DESTROY is used to free the allocated memory object associated with the window. The WM_NCDESTROY message is sent after the child windows have been destroyed. In contrast, WM_DESTROY is sent before the child windows are destroyed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCCALCSIZE
member.summary: The WM_NCCALCSIZE message is sent when the size and position of a window's client area must be calculated. By processing this message, an application can control the content of the window's client area when the size or position of the window changes.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCHITTEST
member.summary: The WM_NCHITTEST message is sent to a window when the cursor moves, or when a mouse button is pressed or released. If the mouse is not captured, the message is sent to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is sent to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCPAINT
member.summary: The WM_NCPAINT message is sent to a window when its frame must be painted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_NCACTIVATE message is sent to a window when its nonclient area needs to be changed to indicate an active or inactive state.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.GETDLGCODE
member.summary: The WM_GETDLGCODE message is sent to the window procedure associated with a control. By default, the system handles all keyboard input to the control; the system interprets certain types of keyboard input as dialog box navigation keys. To override this default behavior, the control can respond to the WM_GETDLGCODE message to indicate the types of input it wants to process itself.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SYNCPAINT
member.summary: The WM_SYNCPAINT message is used to synchronize painting while avoiding linking independent GUI threads.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCMOUSEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_NCMOUSEMOVE message is posted to a window when the cursor is moved within the nonclient area of the window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCLBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCLBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCLBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCLBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCLBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_NCLBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCRBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCRBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCRBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCRBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCRBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_NCRBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCMBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCMBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCMBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCMBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCMBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_NCMBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCXBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCXBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the first or second X button while the cursor is in the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCXBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCXBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the first or second X button while the cursor is in the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.NCXBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_NCXBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the first or second X button while the cursor is in the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.INPUT_DEVICE_CHANGE
member.summary: The WM_INPUT_DEVICE_CHANGE message is sent to the window that registered to receive raw input. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.INPUT
member.summary: The WM_INPUT message is sent to the window that is getting raw input.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.KEYFIRST
member.summary: This message filters for keyboard messages.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.KEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_KEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is pressed. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.KEYUP
member.summary: The WM_KEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is released. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed, or a keyboard key that is pressed when a window has the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.CHAR
member.summary: The WM_CHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_KEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. The WM_CHAR message contains the character code of the key that was pressed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.DEADCHAR
member.summary: The WM_DEADCHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_KEYUP message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. WM_DEADCHAR specifies a character code generated by a dead key. A dead key is a key that generates a character, such as the umlaut (double-dot), that is combined with another character to form a composite character. For example, the umlaut-O character () is generated by typing the dead key for the umlaut character, and then typing the O key.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SYSKEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user presses the F10 key (which activates the menu bar) or holds down the ALT key and then presses another key. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SYSKEYUP
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user releases a key that was pressed while the ALT key was held down. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYUP message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SYSCHAR
member.summary: The WM_SYSCHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. It specifies the character code of a system character key that is, a character key that is pressed while the ALT key is down.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.NativeMethods.WM.SYSDEADCHAR
